title: U.S. Department of Energy Awards Team Led by Ginkgo Bioworks Funding to Develop Algal Crop Protection Solutions - PR Newswire
summary: Ginkgo Bioworks, along with partners, has been awarded funding by the U.S. Department of Energy to develop new algal crop protection solutions to enhance productivity in outdoor environments for biofuels and bioproducts. The project aims to create environmentally-friendly alternatives to conventional chemical pesticides through the use of antimicrobial peptides and adaptive laboratory evolution.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is a green innovation as it involves developing environmentally-friendly solutions to protect algal crops and enhance productivity for biofuel production, aligning with sustainability goals and reducing negative environmental impacts.
business_innovation: TRUE. This is a business innovation as it involves introducing new algal crop protection solutions to the market, significantly differing from previous pest management strategies and aiming to enhance productivity for biofuels and bioproducts.
green_product: FALSE. The article does not focus on a specific tangible product but rather on the development of solutions and technologies for algal crop protection, which do not fit the comprehensive definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE. This is a green process as it involves the development of methods and techniques to protect algal crops in a sustainable manner, aiming to minimize environmental impacts, reduce chemical pesticide usage, and enhance productivity in a more eco-friendly way.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325199 - All Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing, 541715 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences, 541711 - Research and Development in Biotechnology, 424690 - Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers
greenwashing: FALSE. The article focuses on the genuine development of innovative algal crop protection solutions using antimicrobial peptides, with the aim of enhancing sustainability and productivity, rather than making false or misleading environmental claims.

title: The EU wants to put a tax on emissions from imports. It's irked some other nations at COP28 - The Associated Press
summary: The European Union plans to tax the carbon pollution on goods imported from countries like India and China to set a price on carbon emissions for energy-intensive products, aiming to reduce emissions and create a level-playing field for products made in the EU. Developing countries fear such tariffs will harm their economies and livelihoods, with debates ongoing at the COP28 climate conference in Dubai.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 511110 - Newspaper Publishers, 519190 - All Other Information Services, 541850 - Display Advertising, 511120 - Periodical Publishers

title: Millennium Welt, Gentari break ground on EV charging flagship store - theSun
summary: Millennium Welt and Gentari Malaysia broke ground on their first EV Charging Flagship Store in Kuala Lumpur, offering a new concept for electric vehicle charging in Southeast Asia. The store, powered by renewable energy, will feature 66 cutting-edge electric vehicles, various charging points, and a range of integrated services.
